treetaggerwrapper module¶

treetaggerwrapper – Python wrapper for TreeTagger¶

author:Laurent Pointal <laurent.pointal@limsi.fr> <laurent.pointal@laposte.net>
organization:CNRS - LIMSI
copyright:CNRS - 2004-2009
license:GNU-GPL Version 3 or greater
version:$Id$

For TreeTagger, see Helmut Schmid TreeTagger site.

For this module, see:

  • Project page

  • Source documentation

  • Source repository

  • Recent source

    You can also retrieve the latest version of this module with the svn command:

    svn export https://subversion.cru.fr/ttpw/trunk/treetaggerwrapper/treetaggerwrapper.py

This wrapper tool is intended to be used in larger projects, where multiple chunk of texts must be processed via TreeTagger (else you may simply use the base TreeTagger installation as an external command).

Installation¶

Simply put the module in a directory listed in the Python path.

You should set up an environment variable TAGDIR to reference the TreeTagger software installation directory (the one with bin, lib and cmd subdirectories). If you dont set up such a variable, you can give a TAGDIR named argument when building a TreeTagger object to provide this information.

Usage¶

Example:

>>> import treetaggerwrapper
>>> #1) build a TreeTagger wrapper:
>>> tagger = treetaggerwrapper.TreeTagger(TAGLANG='en',TAGDIR='~/TreeTagger')
>>> #2) tag your text.
>>> tags = tagger.TagText("This is a very short text to tag.")
>>> #3) use the tags list... (list of string output from TreeTagger).
>>> print tags
['This      DT      this',
 'is        VBZ     be',
 'a DT      a',
 'very      RB      very',
 'short     JJ      short',
 'text      NN      text',
 'to        TO      to',
 'tag       VB      tag',
 '. SENT    .']
>>> # Note: in output strings, fields are separated with tab chars.

The module can be used as a command line tool too, for more information ask for module help:

python treetaggerwrapper.py --help

Processing¶

Encoding¶

By default files and str strings are considered to be using latin1 encoding.

  • You can specify the encoding when using the script as a command-line tool,

    with the -e param (see online help).

  • When using the script as an embedded tool into a larger project, you can use different parameter types as TreeTagger.TagText() text parameter.

    • You can use unicode strings, and TagText() will return list of unicode strings. If you fill’in TagText with a list of strings and dont provide and encoding parameter, TagText will also return unicode strings (same if you set encoding to unicode or “unicode”.
    • You can use str strings and specify an alternate encoding (and an alternate errors detection), and TagText() will automatically convert input from this encoding and output to this encoding.

This module does two main things¶

  • Manage preprocessing of text in place of external Perl scripts as in base TreeTagger installation, thus avoid starting Perl each time a chunk of text must be tagged.
  • Keep alive a pipe connected to TreeTagger process, and use that pipe to send data and retrieve tags, thus avoid starting TreeTagger each time.

Use of pipes avoid writing/reading temporary files on disk too.

Other things done by this module¶

  • Can number lines into XML tags (to identify lines after TreeTagger processing).
  • Can mark whitespaces with XML tags.
  • By default replace non-talk parts like URLs, emails, IP addresses, DNS names (can be turned off). Replaced by a ‘replaced-xxx’ string followed by an XML tag containing the replaced text as attribute.
  • Acronyms like U.S.A. are systematically written with a final dot, even if it is missing in original file.

In normal mode, all journal outputs are done via Python standard logging system, standard output is only used if a) you run the module in pipe mode (ie. results goes to stdout), or b) you set DEBUG or DEBUG_PREPROCESS global variables and you use the module directly on command line (which make journal and other traces to be sent to stdout).

For an example of logging use, see enable_debugging_log() function.

Note

Some non-exported functions and globals can be nice to use in other contexts: SGML_tag, IsSGMLTag(), SplitSGML(), Ip_expression, DnsHost_expression, UrlMatch_expression, EmailMatch_expression, PipeWriter().

Module globals and constants¶

treetaggerwrapper.DEBUG(boolean)¶

Set to enable debugging code (mainly logs).

treetaggerwrapper.DEBUG_PREPROCESS(boolean)¶

Set to enable preprocessing specific debugging code.

treetaggerwrapper.RESEXT(string)¶

Extension added to result files when using command-line (‘ttr’).

treetaggerwrapper.logger(logging.Logger)¶

Logger object for this module.

treetaggerwrapper.STARTOFTEXT(string)¶

Tag to identify begin of a text in the data flow.

treetaggerwrapper.ENDOFTEXT(string)¶

Tag to identify end of a text in the data flow.

treetaggerwrapper.NUMBEROFLINE(string)¶

Tag to identify line numbers from source text.

treetaggerwrapper.TAGSPACE(string)¶

Tag to identify spaces in output.

treetaggerwrapper.TAGTAB(string)¶

Tag to identify horizontal tabulations in output.

treetaggerwrapper.TAGLF(string)¶

Tag to identify line feeds in output.

treetaggerwrapper.TAGCR(string)¶

Tag to identify carriage returns in output.

treetaggerwrapper.TAGVT(string)¶

Tag to identify vertical tabulations in output.

treetaggerwrapper.TAGFF(string)¶

Tag to identify form feeds in output.

treetaggerwrapper.TREETAGGER_ENCODING(string)¶

In/out encoding for TreeTagger (latin1).

treetaggerwrapper.TREETAGGER_INENCERR(str)¶

Management of encoding errors fot TT input (replace).

treetaggerwrapper.TREETAGGER_OUTENCERR(str)¶

Management of decoding errors of TT output (replace).

treetaggerwrapper.USER_ENCODING(str)¶

Default input and output for files and strings with no encoding specified (latin1).

treetaggerwrapper.DEFAULT_ENCERRORS(str)¶

Error processing for user data encoding/decoding (strict).

treetaggerwrapper.alonemarks(string)¶

String containing chars which must be kept alone (this string is used in regular expressions inside square brackets parts).

treetaggerwrapper.g_langsupport(dict)¶

Dictionnary with data for each usable langage.

g_langsupport[langage] ==> dict of data

treetaggerwrapper.SGML_name(string)¶

Regular expression string for XML names.

treetaggerwrapper.SGML_tag(string)¶

Regular expression string to match XML tags.

treetaggerwrapper.SGML_tag_re(re.SRE_Pattern)¶

Regular expression object to match XML tags.

treetaggerwrapper.Ip_expression(string)¶

Regular expression string to match IP addresses.

treetaggerwrapper.IpMatch_re(re.SRE_Pattern)¶

Regular expression object to match IP addresses.

treetaggerwrapper.DnsHost_expression(string)¶

Regular expression string to match DNS names.

treetaggerwrapper.DnsHostMatch_re(re.SRE_Pattern)¶

Regular expression object to match DNS names.

treetaggerwrapper.UrlMatch_expression(string)¶

Regular expression string to match URLs.

treetaggerwrapper.UrlMatch_re(re.SRE_Pattern)¶

Regular expression object to match URLs.

treetaggerwrapper.EmailMatch_expression(string)¶

Regular expression string to match email addresses.

treetaggerwrapper.EmailMatch_re(re.SRE_Pattern)¶

Regular expression object to match email addresses.

Module exceptions, class and functions¶

exception treetaggerwrapper.TreeTaggerError¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

For exceptions generated directly by TreeTagger class code.

class treetaggerwrapper.TreeTagger(**kargs)¶

Bases: object

Wrap TreeTagger binary to optimize its usage on multiple texts.

The two main methods you may use are the L{__init__()} initializer, and the L{TagText()} method to process your data and get TreeTagger output results.

Variables:
  • lang – langage supported by this tagger (‘en’, ‘fr’, ‘de’, ‘es).
  • langsupport – dictionnary of langage specific values (ref. to g_langsupport[lang] dictionnary).
  • tagdir – path to directory of installation of TreeTagger. Set via TAGDIR env. var or construction param.
  • tagbindir – path to binary dir into TreeTagger dir.
  • tagcmddir – path to commands dir into TreeTagger dir.
  • taglibdir – path to libraries dir into TreeTagger dir.
  • tagbin – path to TreeTagger binary file (used to launch process).
  • tagopt – command line options for TreeTagger.
  • tagparfile – path to TreeTagger library file.
  • abbrevfile – path to abbreviations file.
  • taginencoding – encoding to use for TreeTagger input encoding.
  • tagoutencoding – encoding to use for TreeTagger output decoding.
  • taginencerr – management of encoding errors for TreeTagger input.
  • tagoutencerr – management of encoding errors for TreeTagger output.
  • abbterms – dictionnary of abbreviation terms for fast lookup. Filled when reading abbreviations file.
  • pchar – characters which have to be cut off at the beginning of a word. Filled from g_langsupport dict.
  • pchar_re – regular expression object to cut-off such chars.
  • fchar – characters which have to be cut off at the end of a word. Filled from g_langsupport dict.
  • fchar_re – regular expression object to cut-off such chars.
  • pclictic – character sequences which have to be cut off at the beginning of a word. Filled from g_langsupport dict.
  • pclictic_re – regular expression object to cut-off pclictic sequences.
  • fclictic – character sequences which have to be cut off at the end of a word. Filled from g_langsupport dict.
  • fclictic_re – regular expression object to cut-off fclictic sequences.
  • number – regular expression of number recognition for the langage. Filled from g_langsupport dict.
  • number_re – regular expression object to identify numbers.
  • dummysequence – just a small but complete sentence in the langage. Filled from g_langsupport dict.
  • replurlexp – regular expression subtitution string for URLs.
  • replemailexp – regular expression subtitution string for emails.
  • replipexp – regular expression subtitution string for IP addresses.
  • repldnsexp – regular expression subtitution string for DNS names.
  • tagpopen – TreeTagger process control tool.
  • taginput – pipe to write to TreeTagger input. Set whe opening pipe.
  • tagoutput – pipe to read from TreeTagger input. Set whe opening pipe.
PreparePart(text)¶

Prepare a basic text.

Prepare non-SGML text parts.

Parameters:text (unicode) – unicode text of part to process.
Returns:List of lines to process as TreeTagger input.
Return type:[ unicode ]
PrepareText(text, tagblanks, numlines, notagurl, notagemail, notagip, notagdns)¶

Prepare a text for processing by TreeTagger.

Parameters:
  • text (unicode / [ unicode ]) – the text to split into base elements.
  • tagblanks (boolean) – transform blanks chars into SGML tags.
  • numlines (boolean) – indicator to pur tag for line numbering.
  • notagurl (boolean) – indicator to not do URL replacement (default to False).
  • notagemail (boolean) – indicator to not do email address replacement (default to False).
  • notagip (boolean) – indicator to not do IP address replacement (default to False).
  • notagdns (boolean) – indicator to not do DNS names replacement (default to False).
Returns:

List of lines to process as TreeTagger input (no n at end of line).
Return type:

[ unicode ]
SetLangage(kargs)¶

Set langage for tagger.

Internal use.

SetPreprocessor(kargs)¶

Set preprocessing files, and options.

Internal use.

SetTagger(kargs)¶

Set tagger paths, files, and options.

Internal use.

StartProcess()¶

Start TreeTagger processing chain.

Internal use.

TagText(text, numlines=False, tagonly=False, prepronly=False, tagblanks=False, notagurl=False, notagemail=False, notagip=False, notagdns=False, encoding=None, errors='strict')¶

Tag a text and return corresponding lines.

This is normally the method you use on this class. Other methods are only helpers of this one.

Parameters:
  • text (string / [ string ]) – the text to tag.
  • numlines (boolean) – indicator to keep line numbering information in data flow (done via SGML tags) (default to False).
  • tagonly (boolesn) – indicator to only do TreeTagger tagging processing on input (default to False).
  • prepronly (boolean) – indicator to only do preprocessing of text without tagging (default to False).
  • tagblanks (boolean) – indicator to keep blanks characters information in data flow (done via SGML tags) (default to False).
  • notagurl (boolean) – indicator to not do URL replacement (default to False).
  • notagemail (boolean) – indicator to not do email address replacement (default to False).
  • notagip (boolean) – indicator to not do IP address replacement (default to False).
  • notagdns (boolean) – indicator to not do DNS names replacement (default to False).
  • encoding (C{str}) – encoding of input data (default to latin1 for C{str} text and unicode for C{unicode} text), usable values are standard encodings + C{“unicode”} and C{unicode} type. Mandatory if text is a C{list} or C{tuple} of strings.
  • errors (C{str}) – indicator how to manage encoding/decoding errors for your data, can be strict / replace / ignore (default to strict).
Returns:

List of output lines from the tagger, unicode or str strings.
Return type:

[ string ]
